Posts.Content: Have to admit that I'm a little bit envious... no, it's not in my personality but a cruise is just the most AWESOME vacation!! There is nothing to do but eat, lay around in the sun, drink, dance, eat some more and drink some more! I just love going on a cruise. I have said that once treatment is over and I have a decent amount of hair on my head, even if I have to take a loan, I will once again take my kids on another cruise. Please share your wonderful memories when you come back!! (no need to tell you to have a good time as it's assured that you WILL)
Posts.Title: Anchors aweigh!!!!

Posts.Content: That's terrific, Tracy! I'm so happy for you! Having a wig that you and everyone else likes makes a HUGE difference. I'm getting more compliments now than I ever was and at this stage of the game, I can use it! YAY, that you are no longer in pain and double YAY that you are laughing and ok with it! Love ~ Mar
Posts.Title: Does head soreness go away after hair comes out?? (hopefully??)

Posts.Content: I only buzzed it real short, never shaved my head... still haven't and I still have a little peach fuzz. It did stop hurting when I buzzed it short and has been fine ever since. Guess it's just during that 'fall out' period.
Posts.Title: Does head soreness go away after hair comes out?? (hopefully??)

Posts.Content: I will say a prayer for successful surgeries and a quick & easy recovery. I believe in the power of prayer... it has gotten me this far and I continue to reap the rewards! Please let us know how it goes. Hugs, Mar
Posts.Title: surgery next wednesday

Posts.Content: What a very BEAUTIFUL card from a very BEAUTIFUL lady! Thanks so very much... it made me smile BIG as it just makes the friends we make on here so real! You're a very special lady and give so many, including myself, hope & inspiration! Love ~ Mar
Posts.Title: Chen~You Cheated!!

Posts.Content: I have been concerned as well. Hoping no news is good news! I'm sure she will be happy to see all the care on here. God, I love this site! Sure hope we get an update soon!
Posts.Title: Anyone heard from Kari's daughter

Posts.Content: So sorry you're not feeling well, Sunrae! It's funny, but your name to me has always been a reflection of your personality... a ray of sunshine is what I think to myself. I hope & pray you sleep better tonight and that you are given peace that you will be ok. Sometimes the worry & the stress make it worse than it actually is. I hope all goes well at the doctor tomorrow and only uphill from there! My thoughts and prayers are with you! Please let us know how things went and how you are as soon as you can. Big hugs, Mar
Posts.Title: Feeling Bad but Looking forward to Heart Cath Tomorrow

Posts.Content: This was extremely inspirational, Pitt. Thanks so much for sharing. I've been extremely tired! Like you, before diagnosis, I worked out everyday. I was very energetic and felt great about myself. I have slowly sloped downhill since chemo and have 'gone with the flow' sort of speak. I always worked out early in the morning before waking my kids up for school. In order to do that, I woke up @ 5am. Well, I've attempted on a few occasions to set my alarm for 5 and when it went off in the morning, I changed it to 6, convincing myself that sleep is more important. I feel if only one day I could wake up @ 5, it would turn things around because right now it's a vicious cycle. I don't have energy because I'm not working out and I don't work out because I don't have the energy. I hope I can get to where you are real soon because I know for a fact that it makes all the difference in the world~! You sound wonderful and we all know because we've seen you in a scarf, you ARE beautiful! Keep up the good work and keep us posted. It's very motivating! Mar
Posts.Title: Facing forward - exercising again!

Posts.Content: Yes, you're right, Barb. I'm so thrilled that you liked it I'm a little disappointed, however, as I included a note with it and that obviously wasn't included :( Anyway... To my sister-in-pink with Love, Hope & Faith, Marlene
Posts.Title: Another happy ornament recipient!

Posts.Content: I'm definetly not as enthusastic as I usually am. My daughter came home from college for Thanksgiving and wanted our tree up. Her, her girlfriend and my boys helped with moving furniture and getting everything up from the basement. They put it up along with lights & decorations on Thanksgving eve. Thank God for that! My princess is stepping up to the plate for sure. Normally she would hang one or two ornaments while she watched the rest of us, lol. I keep putting up things little by little, but don't think I'm going to do it all as I usually do. We're going to a friends house for Christmas Eve, and I have my kids Christmas morning, but for dinner, they'll be with their dad, so it's not necessary to go as crazy as I normally would. I will also be getting my 4th treatment on Christmas Eve morning, but I usually don't feel too bad the day of or the day after. It's after my Neulasta shot that I get grounded for a couple days. I'm glad the ornament gave you a little lift and hope you get done what's most important! Love ~ Mar PS I don't see my new pic on here... I hate that. I see people changing their pics all the time and it seems to take me FOREVER!
Posts.Title: Another happy ornament recipient!

Posts.Content: I must say that it feels good not to be alone. I was never nauseated and I ate like a PIG while I was on chemo... like everything in site and sweets were definitely my favorite. Working out was impossible as I barely had enough strength to walk to the bathroom at times. Oh, but to get up and walk to the kitchen for food always came easy! It also didn't help that most everyone around me said it was great that I didn't lose my appetite and that gaining weight while on chemo was way better than losing. HAH! Easy for THEM to say. I gained 20 lbs! I ended chemo on Feb. 4th and am slowly getting healthier eating habits. I started exercising two weeks ago. I will be done with radiation in just three short days and am hoping that I will soon get back into shape. I guess if you think if it as temporary and make a plan for afterwards, it's all good. The MOST important thing for all of us is to be healthy!
Posts.Title: Can't stop eating!

Posts.Content: That's fantastic, Laurissa! You sound terrific. I'm so happy for you! I will be starting rads soon too. I was hoping for Monday but I didn't hear from my doctor's office with my schedule so I guess not :( But it sounds like we'll be running across that finish line together. YIPEE! I will be looking into reconstruction down the road, but I'm thinking of that as 'fun stuff'. Don't overdo, lady! I don't think you should be doing laundry just yet... isn't there someone that could spoil you for a bit longer? Hugs, Mar
Posts.Title: Glad to meet you, NED

Posts.Content: I was diagnosed in June 09; I was 47. I had my mastectomy 3 days before my 48th birthday. I'm 48 now but feel like 88! Talk about chemo brain... I had to edit this twice because I had my age wrong. UGGGHHH!
Posts.Title: age when diagnosed?

Posts.Content: Happy Birthday, Barb! I almost missed it. I had a very LOUSY day today and this is the first time I've been well enough to sit at the computer. Hope your birthday was as special as you are and that there are many more wonderful ones to come! With love & hugs ~ Mar

Posts.Content: As I plan to ride it out for a loooong time :) Aug 30th Very sweet idea!
Posts.Title: When is Your Birthday?

Posts.Content: As I plan to ride it out for a loooong time :) Aug 30th Very sweet idea!
Posts.Title: When is Your Birthday?

Posts.Content: Good for you! That must feel great! I think I will be making my appt soon to have mine out. My doctor originally said he likes to keep it in for 3 months, but that it's my option. Some take it out immediately. Well on May 4th it WILL be 3 months, so I think I'm gonna set it up :)) How does it look? Does it look better than that big lump that sticks out? I'm always looking to cover it up because I hate when it shows.
Posts.Title: My port

Posts.Content: We made it without losing power ~ YAY! I have to work this morning and am very grateful. It seems my eldest son (being a night owl) went and shoveled me out last night after I went to bed. God, I love my kids! Homefree until Monday? I hear there's another one coming. UGGGGHHH! Focusing on the beach with a margarita, Meena :)
Posts.Title: SOCKED WITH SNOW......IN PHILADELPHIA

Posts.Content: Yep, here too Meena. This is just unreal! So much snow. My lights just recently flickered and I'm praying the electric doesn't go out! Although I've had the TV on all day and am tired of them interrupting with the snow update. I can do without the TV, but doing without heat will totally STINK! I'm not fortunate enough to have a fireplace so it WILL get cold. I heard there's another one coming on Monday. Spring can't come soon enough! Glad you're warm, safe & well fed, Meena... hope we all stay this way :)
Posts.Title: SOCKED WITH SNOW......IN PHILADELPHIA

Posts.Content: I'm not sure if you are one of us that takes anti-anxiety meds, but other than having babies, I never experienced anything medical until my BC diagnosis. A friend of mine came with me to all my appts and once I got the confirmation that I had cancer, my friend insisted that the doctor write me up a script for Xanex. From then on, any type of test I went for I would ask if it was ok to take it prior to the procedure. They even said it was ok to take it the morning of my mastectomy as long as it wouldn't put me to sleep. I get extremely worked up over anything medical and this has definitely helped me get through each & every one. I had a mugascan done and was told I could take it for that and that has to do with the heart. Perhaps this would help with some of your anxiety. Also, they do these tests to make sure we will be ok under anesthesia. You are being watched very carefully and I would think they would be able to reverse any ill side effects if they should occur... I'm guessing. I don't know this for sure. Oh I sooo feel for you, Sunrae. I know & understand how stressful these stinkin tests can be. I hope you are having a lot of undue concern, like we all usually do, and that everything goes along just fine. Please take a deep breath and know that you are in God's hands. You are in my prayers and please let us know how things go! Hugs, Mar
Posts.Title: Finally Made My Decision Re Surgery

Posts.Content: I can see why they make your heart happy, Nat... Gosh, I wanna just squeeeeze those cheeks! Absolutely adorable they are. Sure hope it's in the cards that you can be with Brooke next week. I know how good it would do you to see her and most especially 'HOLD' her. You've got to squeeze those cheeks for me :)
Posts.Title: New photos of Brooke and Charlie

Posts.Content: Lorraine, I just love your fortitude and great attitude! We are the next up & coming generation, lol. As I'm sure you recognize many on this list as I do because they were our saviors during our big time of need (not like it's over or anything, but things don't quite feel as 'doom & gloom' as they did at first). Most of that I owe to soooo many wonderful people on this site! Hopefully, if we give even just one person this very same feeling, it will all seem worth it! I just LOVE your new pic on here BTW, as it truly expresses what we should ALL feel like!

Posts.Content: Are you on your way tomorrow??? How are you feeling? Hope you get a chance to let us know. Love, Mar

Posts.Title: Hands off, girls -- NED is all mine today!

Posts.Content: I ordered one, but haven't received it yet. I probably won't be starting chemo for about 3-4 weeks. I would be happy to send you a pic, but that may be too long away. She is a truly wonderful lady and that it really nice of you to think of doing this. It's a fantastic idea!
Posts.Title: For all who have received a scarf or headwrap from Laurie....

Posts.Content: Jenny, I can feel your anxiety and can very much relate to it. I'm guessing I should be having that done soon myself and I did wonder about the side of the mastectomy. Doesn't look like anyone addressed that yet. I am very curious to know how they monitor that wonderful 'flat' side. But, just like everything else we've been through... we hype ourselves up, freak out and usually come out it with a big sigh! I can't wait to hear you sigh :)

Posts.Content: Major inspirational words! I look forward to posting a similar post in the future. Thank you from the bottom of my heart!
Posts.Title: Inflammatory Breast cancer

Posts.Content: I tried replying to this earlier and it didn't post. After reading that there were obviously problems, I figured I wouldn't try again. I'm gonna copy & paste to see if I can get this to go through. I'm glad it's overwith for you, Laurissa. I am right behind you on this path and I hope I can be as brave. Looking forward to seeing pics of you; I bet you look wonderful! And from what your sister posted, your wig is red?? Oh, please do show!
Posts.Title: I'm BUZZED (clipper buzzed that is)
